Paragraph: My wife and I were fortunate enough to have chosen this spa for our anniversary weekend.   What an amazing spot!   From the moment we arrived 'til we left, we were pampered and fed like kings and queens.   The spa experience was amazing, and the food is really spectacular.   The grounds are so beautiful, especially now with all the perennials blooming.  The outdoor pool was warm and inviting, and the hiking trails gave us a touch of nature in the beautiful Haldimand hills of Northumberland.   We had a suite directly above the reception (Christine Agatha) which was well appointed with a huge bathroom featuring a double soaker tub and shower.  The king bed was in a massive room with high ceilings and views out to the hills and the landscaped courtyards below.   Each of the four meals we had were simply amazing.  The chef and his team served creations that were not complex but very well thought-through.   The staff were warm and genuine; something that is hard to find in resort-type settings.   Despite being busy with the 'day' crowd, this spa never felt crowded or over-run.  The room was quite and romantic, and we had a fabulous time.We will be coming back to Ste. Anne's as often as we can!Thanks, Jim and your wonderful family and staff.   What a gem!Mike and Janet Brown
Context: My wife and I were fortunate enough to have chosen this spa for our anniversary weekend.
Sentence: What an amazing spot!

Paragraph: When we were shown our room it had a sewage smell and was very hot, it was room 314.When i tried  to use air conditioning it was set for heat only. Complained to deck staff, said hotel full and came up and closed window. Had a terrible nights sleep due to heat, had to sleep with no covers for 2 nights.I think the hotel should mention that room does not have outside window and charge accordingly as do some other hotels.I must say that the breakfast was excellent.
Context: When we were shown our room it had a sewage smell and was very hot, it was room 314.When i tried  to use air conditioning it was set for heat only. Complained to deck staff, said hotel full and came up and closed window.
Sentence: Had a terrible nights sleep due to heat, had to sleep with no covers for 2 nights.I think the hotel should mention that room does not have outside window and charge accordingly as do some other hotels.I must say that the breakfast was excellent.

Paragraph: Stayed here for 2 nights at the start of June and really wish it could have been longer! Very friendly staff, very spacious, immaculate room, comfy bed and amazing shower! The only downside is the toilet door. It was a glass door that didn't lock and had a large gap at the top and the bottom of the door, not very good if you like to do the toilet in privacy. But all in all, I wouldn't hesitate to go back!
Context: Very friendly staff, very spacious, immaculate room, comfy bed and amazing shower! The only downside is the toilet door. It was a glass door that didn't lock and had a large gap at the top and the bottom of the door, not very good if you like to do the toilet in privacy.
Sentence: But all in all, I wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Paragraph: Restaurant only - booked a table for 7pm arrived 6.55 told to take a seat in the lounge 45 minutes later they advised our table was ready,no waiter came to collect our drinks we had to lift,coats brollies and drinks and head thru to the dinning area .we thne waited a good 20 minutes before James arrived to take our order. A number of staff had advised us during the 20 minute delaythat someone would take our order.We all shared the Haggis cakes which were lovely,this was the only high point of the evening. My Lamb Kebab was nohing like a kebab, they were more like 2 Birdseye chipsteaks,very poor.The male toilets were also disgusting just to finish, sorry we won't be back.,.
Sentence: Restaurant only - booked a table for 7pm arrived 6.55 told to take a seat in the lounge 45 minutes later they advised our table was ready,no waiter came to collect our drinks we had to lift,coats brollies and drinks and head thru to the dinning area .we thne waited a good 20 minutes before James arrived to take our order.

Paragraph: Our organization just got back from another fantastic conference at the Town and Country. What makes this property different, besides how lush and welcoming  the outdoor areas are, is the people who work here. Mark Yunker, our convention services manager, was fantastic. But, so was every staff member we encountered. From management, to housekeeping, to the whistling gardeners we would come across in the morning.  Though it is hard to be away from home for two weeks, the Town and Country helped to make us feel like part of their family.
Sentence: Our organization just got back from another fantastic conference at the Town and Country.

Paragraph: A beautiful and elegant hotel in a soulless city!! The only good thing is the leaning tower of Pisa but otherwise you could bypass this city and just visit for the day!! If you do have to stay then Bologna hotel is a gem. The room for 4 was very spacious and well appointed. Hotel staff were excellent and the breakfast yummy!! ( great gluten free options too) We ate at the # 1 ranked restaurant on trip advisor "Hostaria Le Repubbliche Marinare" and also recommended by the hotel ,which we found to be pretty average!
Context: A beautiful and elegant hotel in a soulless city!!
Sentence: The only good thing is the leaning tower of Pisa but otherwise you could bypass this city and just visit for the day!!

Paragraph: we stayed in a large chalet, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms.  Way more spacious than any caravan/mobile home we've stayed in before.  It was very clean and very well equipped and furnished.  Beautifully planted gardens.  The pool is lovely and the food at the restaurant was good though the waiter was somewhat surly.  It is 10 mins walk to the Tower (through the underpass of doom but in reality only takes 2 mins to walk through and is well lit).   There is a large supermarket (Pam) on the other side of the underpass where you can get everything you need and within 15 mins walk you have a great choice of restaurants though we enjoyed cooking and eating on our verandah as well.We got free wifi, they printed our boarding passes without a quibble and gave us a bottle of chianti when we checked out.    We're planning to go back next year.
Context: Way more spacious than any caravan/mobile home we've stayed in before. It was very clean and very well equipped and furnished. Beautifully planted gardens.
Sentence: The pool is lovely and the food at the restaurant was good though the waiter was somewhat surly.

Paragraph: We had a renovated room in the Royal Palms Tower on a Travelzoo deal, so we felt we got our money's worth.  We would not stay again unless we got a similar deal.  We arrived an hour before check in time and our room was ready.  This is an older hotel though our building had been refurbished.  As such, there were no ventilation fans in the bathrooms.  There were no mini-fridges in the room.  That seems it could be easily corrected. We ate breakfast on the property each morning.  The buffet is $14, definitely overpriced.  My husband had the buffet both days and said the food was hot the first day.  Second day it was barely warm.  He called it cold.  First day we were able to get a copy of USA Today, Second day they were all gone.  They are a convention hotel and seem to struggle a bit to keep up with the large influx of people at times.  We had only one water glass in our room the first day.  The second day the housekeeper did not check the coffee supplies.  She left a dirty pot and no coffee.  So in the morning my husband made his way to the lobby for a cup of coffee that is supposed to be served until 9.  He arrived at 10 minutes to 9 and it had been cleaned up and put away.  The woman gave a very insincere apology which is probably what stuck with us most about the visit.  Customer service can be everything in a situation like that.
Context: We had a renovated room in the Royal Palms Tower on a Travelzoo deal, so we felt we got our money's worth. We would not stay again unless we got a similar deal. We arrived an hour before check in time and our room was ready.
Sentence: This is an older hotel though our building had been refurbished.

Paragraph: The property is very nice, big, and has alot to offer. We went to dinner at trellis's, which has a piano bar and excellent service until we got up from our table to take a pic with our cell phone, only to come back and find my 1200.00 camera missing. All the pics we had taking over a 10 day period, lost. Tried to call Lost and found over 5 times to no return call, same with security. I was brushed off numerous times, and still have no call back to even offer any resolution.
Context: The property is very nice, big, and has alot to offer. We went to dinner at trellis's, which has a piano bar and excellent service until we got up from our table to take a pic with our cell phone, only to come back and find my 1200.00 camera missing. All the pics we had taking over a 10 day period, lost.
Sentence: Tried to call Lost and found over 5 times to no return call, same with security.

Paragraph: When arriving to check in, we were told our cc was not approved so we left-to find out afterwards that it was and they charged $250 to it.   When we phoned the manager about it he was rude and we never got an apology.  We were very disappointed-after being on the road all day with a toddler and ready to settle in for the night, we wound up driving around the city for an hour trying to find another hotel.   Worst experience ever!!!  Don't recommend unless you like dealing with snobs.
Context: When arriving to check in, we were told our cc was not approved so we left-to find out afterwards that it was and they charged $250 to it. When we phoned the manager about it he was rude and we never got an apology. We were very disappointed-after being on the road all day with a toddler and ready to settle in for the night, we wound up driving around the city for an hour trying to find another hotel.
Sentence: Worst experience ever!!!

Paragraph: Very friendly and helpful front desk staff with excellent English. We stayed in the top floor (room #14) and had a fantastic view of a small park and the Fairmont Le ChÃ¢teau Frontenac. Could not ask for a better location and the price was half what they ask at the Fairmont.  I would stay here and use the money saved to eat at several of the many fine restaurants. Very clean and comfortable, excellent internet, beautifully appointed room with coffee maker, TV, alarm clock, shower (no tub). Parking is not cheap ($25 per day in a nearby public garage and $15 behind the hotel (if available). This particular room was on the fourth floor (no elevator and narrow stairway) and has vaulted ceilings directly under the roof which gives it an open feeling. The exposed brick and stone wall on one side adds to the charm. I would guess that this particular room would be uncomfortably warm on hot summer days but I would not hesitate to take a room on a lower floor. Luckily, we stayed in a period of cool weather because the in room air conditioner unit had trouble keeping up with temperatures in the upper 70's.
Context: We stayed in the top floor (room #14) and had a fantastic view of a small park and the Fairmont Le ChÃ¢teau Frontenac. Could not ask for a better location and the price was half what they ask at the Fairmont. I would stay here and use the money saved to eat at several of the many fine restaurants.
Sentence: Very clean and comfortable, excellent internet, beautifully appointed room with coffee maker, TV, alarm clock, shower (no tub).

Paragraph: Recently I stayed at the Town and Country Resort Hotel while attending an online teaching conference at the hotel's onsite convention facility. I stayed at the hotel because the conference was there and I was provided excellent IT service for my particular needs. I had checked at several other major hotels and only the Town and Country would help me.What a great decision - I found the hotel a wonderful experience. The hotel property is quite large. It had charm beyond what I had envisioned with a variety of room choices ranging from a nostalgic motor court environment to two high rise buildings. I stayed in the Tower and loved it. The room was great with very nice furnishings, a great view and great service.One thing I did not notice when researching the hotel was the fact that the San Diego Trolley was just behind the property line. What a great advantage - my wife and I took the trolley every where we could even though we had rented a car. On my next trip to San Diego I will skip the car rental and save money!The staff at the hotel provided great service. I want to mention several staff members in particular: Peter Stuart provided me excellent help with my IT needs and Jill Moniz, the hotel concierge provided my wife I superior ideas to enhance our San Diego experience. While dining at the main restaurant,...Recently I stayed at the Town and Country Resort Hotel while attending an online teaching conference at the hotel's onsite convention facility. I stayed at the hotel because the conference was there and I was provided excellent IT service for my particular needs. I had checked at several other major hotels and only the Town and Country would help me.What a great decision - I found the hotel a wonderful experience. The hotel property is quite large. It had charm beyond what I had envisioned with a variety of room choices ranging from a nostalgic motor court environment to two high rise buildings. I stayed in the Tower and loved it. The room was great with very nice furnishings, a great view and great service.One thing I did not notice when researching the hotel was the fact that the San Diego Trolley was just behind the property line. What a great advantage - my wife and I took the trolley every where we could even though we had rented a car. On my next trip to San Diego I will skip the car rental and save money!The staff at the hotel provided great service. I want to mention several staff members in particular: Peter Stuart provided me excellent help with my IT needs and Jill Moniz, the hotel concierge provided my wife I superior ideas to enhance our San Diego experience. While dining at the main restaurant, Trellises, Patty was our wait person several times and did a wonderful job.It is a real pleasure to write about this hotel and resort! One final thing - it is close to everything, minutes from the Zoo and minutes from Old Town!More
Context: <span class="summaryText">Recently I stayed at the Town and Country Resort Hotel while attending an online teaching conference at the hotel's onsite convention facility.
Sentence: I stayed at the hotel because the conference was there and I was provided excellent IT service for my particular needs.

Paragraph: I've stayed at the Town and Country three times, and it's been a very good experience each time.  The rooms are nice, and there's a good gym and spa. It's centrally located - close the Balboa Park, with very easy access to local freeways. The proximity to Fashion Valley Mall was convenient for some last minute holiday shopping. There are several good local restaurants within a 5-10 minute drive to San Diego's North Park and South Park neighborhoods. Very good value overall.
Sentence: I've stayed at the Town and Country three times, and it's been a very good experience each time.

Paragraph: I went to Ocean Beach to visit a friend. Ocean Villa Inn was close to him and everything else in town.  It had all the lay I needed. It came with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. The property is very dog friendly and right on dog beach, I loved walking up having coffee on the balcony watching all the dogs run and play on Dog Beach. The complimentary breakfast was simple but satisfying. There was a pool and laundry that I did not take advantage of but both looked clean and ready to go. The staff was very helpfu and friendly, I felt like I was coming home each night I stayed.
Context: I went to Ocean Beach to visit a friend. Ocean Villa Inn was close to him and everything else in town.
Sentence: It had all the lay I needed.

Paragraph: We were picked up from and taken to the airport about 10 mins in a car ! By the owner Monica which was so kind of her , Pisa is a short and pleasant walk away And it is a beautiful town ? The hotel is beautiful inside typical Italian , with beautiful furniture and marble floors,  very tranquil and a lovely courtyard garden , breakfast was fine , lovely cappuccino !thank you Monica .
Context: We were picked up from and taken to the airport about 10 mins in a car !
Sentence: By the owner Monica which was so kind of her , Pisa is a short and pleasant walk away And it is a beautiful town ?

Paragraph: During the 10 hour blackout in San Diego this hotel put together a complimentary cookout (they could have charged for the burgers and made a fortune!) and party by the pool for everyone staying. For something they just threw together at the last minute it was very well organized. The owner and manager kept us updated on everything going on and were very friendly and approachable. Capt. Rez and Jamie at the bar even got us candles and matches to take back to our dark rooms with us. The staff worked overtime and very hard to make everyone feel comfortable and well taken care of!
Context: The owner and manager kept us updated on everything going on and were very friendly and approachable. Capt. Rez and Jamie at the bar even got us candles and matches to take back to our dark rooms with us.
Sentence: The staff worked overtime and very hard to make everyone feel comfortable and well taken care of!

Paragraph: Stayed 2 nights in "yellow room" which I found spacious and neat - Luca is a very friendly host - simple breakfast with Italian coffee and juice.  It only takes a few steps to the Piazza dei Miracoli !  The Via Nicola Pisano is a busy street, traffic noise is a disadvantage.  Pisa is rather small, you can visit the entire city on foot and in one day.  A walk from the 4Rooms B&B to the Pisa Centrale Stazione takes approx. 30 minutes, to the Pisa San Rossore Stazione it's 5 min. on foot.  I took a train (30 min.) to Lucca and would absolutely recommend to combine Pisa with a visit to the beautifull and charming city of Lucca !
Context: Stayed 2 nights in "yellow room" which I found spacious and neat - Luca is a very friendly host - simple breakfast with Italian coffee and juice.
Sentence: It only takes a few steps to the Piazza dei Miracoli !

Paragraph: This is a lovely resort motel, clean and secure.  The rooms are pretty and spotless.  Only one minor issue-no hairdryer in the room.  Otherwise an excellent choice for the business traveller.  Cobourg is a lovely town with everything one could need while "on the road".  I will gladly return to this restful oasis.
Context: This is a lovely resort motel, clean and secure.
Sentence: The rooms are pretty and spotless.

Paragraph: At an auction we bought a package that included 2 nights in this hotel, with breakfast at Black's each morning (see separate review) and golf. The hotel was centrally located, all staff we encountered were really friendly and helpful, the rooms were large, the kitchen well appointed and a nice touch was the chocolates and greeting card from the owner/general manager when we first arrived.  We particularly enjoyed going to the hot tub on the roof and taking advantage of the pool at the hotel across the street. The only negatives were that our large bed was actually 2 twins pushed together. It meant both my husband and I found our "own beds" very comfy but with a large lump of bedding in between, we really couldn't use the middle section and stretch out to take advantage of what looked like a big bed!
Context: At an auction we bought a package that included 2 nights in this hotel, with breakfast at Black's each morning (see separate review) and golf. The hotel was centrally located, all staff we encountered were really friendly and helpful, the rooms were large, the kitchen well appointed and a nice touch was the chocolates and greeting card from the owner/general manager when we first arrived. We particularly enjoyed going to the hot tub on the roof and taking advantage of the pool at the hotel across the street.
Sentence: The only negatives were that our large bed was actually 2 twins pushed together.

Paragraph: The hostel was not located directly in the center, but it was a very pleasant walk to get there. Owners of the hostel are extremely friendly and helpful! Rooms are big, clean and nicely furnished - really comfortable. Kitchen is spacious, clean and well equipped. Hostel is cozy and quiet probably because of big rooms it does not accommodate a lot of people. Perfect for calm stay for two or for having really nice rest
Context: Rooms are big, clean and nicely furnished - really comfortable. Kitchen is spacious, clean and well equipped. Hostel is cozy and quiet probably because of big rooms it does not accommodate a lot of people.
Sentence: Perfect for calm stay for two or for having really nice rest

Paragraph: We stayed for two nights at this wonderful lodge. Fromour arrival to our departure it was relaxing, hassle-free and enjoyable.The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. The room was a good size with comfortable beds, very clean, sufficient outlets for our electronic devices, complimentary wifi and an awesome view from our window.  The bathroom was also clean and had a bathtub that was the right height, easy to safely go in and out of, plus a safety handle on the wall. A tub mat would have been an appreciated additional touch and  towel hooks/racks are needed.The hotel has a popular spa and nice grounds for walks and we especially enjoyed the warmth of the firepit by the hotel entrance driveway. The hotel also has several restaurants and a bar.  The food was mostly good albeit high-priced in one of the restaurants (Cedar), including a long wait for dinner to be served. The breakfast buffet at Forte was average with an unplatable eggs benedict included in the buffet (a la carte for the benny would likely have been a better choice). Forte for dinner was fine.Special mention to the wait staff, Antoine and Gilbert, for their assistance, politeness and pleasing personalities. I would go back to this lodge. Recommended.
Context: We stayed for two nights at this wonderful lodge. Fromour arrival to our departure it was relaxing, hassle-free and enjoyable.The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful.
Sentence: The room was a good size with comfortable beds, very clean, sufficient outlets for our electronic devices, complimentary wifi and an awesome view from our window.

Paragraph: We stay at this hotel frequently when we travel to visit family.  The staff remember us and know us by name and we were once upgraded to a big suite.  We normally stay on the executive floor and enjoy the free breakfast and snack time in the evening.  The snacks are enough for a light dinner.  They give our daughter a small present each time we arrive and it makes her day.  They are quick to respond to any problems or requests you have and room service is great.  The rooms are comfortable and large and all non smoking.The location is great because it is right next to Metrotown (a very large shopping and entertainment complex) so my daughter and I can walk over and shop or play.  It is also close to the skytrain that will talk you downtown Vancouver quickly and easily.  There is a bus loop at the mall as well so public transportation is at your door.  There is only one resturant in the hotel but there are several within easy walking distance.
Sentence: We stay at this hotel frequently when we travel to visit family.

Paragraph: We had room 1. Looks out onto market.  Very noisy in the morning but we didn't mind that. Room lovely. Spotless. Only complaint - no tea and coffee facilities in the room and no bar. Had to use vending machine in corridor for morning tea and coffee. Also, just for info, the annexe, down the road a bit,  has a really lovely terrace. All the staff were lovely.  Very helpful.
Context: Only complaint - no tea and coffee facilities in the room and no bar. Had to use vending machine in corridor for morning tea and coffee. Also, just for info, the annexe, down the road a bit,  has a really lovely terrace.
Sentence: All the staff were lovely.

Paragraph: My business partner and I invited our assistants for a full Spa-Day experience. We all at an individual treatment and we met in between in the "quiet -room" or at the hot-tup area. All the Ladies enjoyed their treatments and the amenities. The lunch menu had a selection for everyone - also for me who enjoys mainly plant-based food. Great location and time to relax from busy work-schedule. Britney, our waitress at tea-time, was outstanding. Very professional and very helping.
Context: All the Ladies enjoyed their treatments and the amenities. The lunch menu had a selection for everyone - also for me who enjoys mainly plant-based food. Great location and time to relax from busy work-schedule.
Sentence: Britney, our waitress at tea-time, was outstanding.

Paragraph: Great rooms, spacious and very comfortable. Nice comfortable beds, blackout curtains great for a sleep-in! Staff very very friendly and an easy walk to everything in the village. Be aware of the Mountain-View rooms, the pubs below have loud-speakers on the outside and without request from the hotel will not shut them off automatically. It was quite loud and upon request the staff kindly moved us to a room on the Valley-View side. The hotel is in the center of the night-time action, we should have expected it. The hotel has valet and non-valet parking. We require access to our vehicle and it was time consuming to keep asking the valet for keys, so he kindly gave them back to us and we parked ourselves.  All in all, we would come back!
Context: It was quite loud and upon request the staff kindly moved us to a room on the Valley-View side. The hotel is in the center of the night-time action, we should have expected it. The hotel has valet and non-valet parking.
Sentence: We require access to our vehicle and it was time consuming to keep asking the valet for keys, so he kindly gave them back to us and we parked ourselves.

Paragraph: Though the room that we stayed at may have appeared to be outdated, the service and staff at the hotel were awesome.  The location was great, close to ski hill and nature trails.  The staff at the restaurants on site were exceptional.  The front desk staff were helpful and set us up with our ski passes, and there was a shuttle to take you to and from the ski hill. I am looking forward to returning with the whole family next year for another ski trip.
Sentence: Though the room that we stayed at may have appeared to be outdated, the service and staff at the hotel were awesome.

Paragraph: We stayed for 2 nights 14th & 15th October, having booked on lastminute.com.  The hotel is well managed, and well-appointed, and the staff friendly and efficient.  The room was large and comfortable, and well furnished.  The minibar was very reasonably priced, and no more expensive than local bars - and the bottled water was free.  The area is OK - south of the river, but the leaning tower is only about 20 mins walk away to the north.  We were advised to stay clear of the railway station at night, which wasn't a problem as everything we wanted to do was north of the hotel anyway.The breakfast was plentiful and varied, with the usual continental choices, plus scrambled eggs and bacon.  The quality of the breakfast was excellent, except for the bacon which was a bit on the thin side.The only complaint, and it was very minor, was that the heating didn't appear to be working in the bedroom, however we asked for an additional blanket the next morning, which was supplied & fitted without a problem.The other thing is the parking.  Not much about close to the hotel, and the hotel charges 10 euros a night to park in their car park.  A bit steep, but the peace of mind made it something that we had little choice about in reality.All in all, a lovely hotel, and a great base from which to explore Pisa.  We'd certainly go back to this hotel, and would recommend it to anybody.
Sentence: We stayed for 2 nights 14th & 15th October, having booked on lastminute.com.

Paragraph: The best thing about this hotel is the location. But, it certainly is not a first rate hotel. The lobby and bar are very modern which seems incongruous with a historic exterior in the heart of the lower old town. We had a room that was a water view room, which should have been classified as "a partial water view." The roof of the restaurant obscured 2/3rds  of our view of the water.  The room was comfortable, but nothing special.And, the housekeeping service was not great. The first night that were at the hotel, someone had left a take out food container on a table near the elevator on our floor. The next afternoon, although the rooms had been made up, it was still there.If this were a mid-range hotel, it would have been fine. But, when you expect a Relais & Chateau, you expect the best.
Context: The best thing about this hotel is the location. But, it certainly is not a first rate hotel.
Sentence: The lobby and bar are very modern which seems incongruous with a historic exterior in the heart of the lower old town.

Paragraph: Overuse of Febreze caused severe allergic reaction. I asked staff not to use it in our room.  Our room was not sprayed, but the hallways were still overly toxic. Plus the room needs to be cleaned, not just masked, as the unsprayed room reeked of vomit, urine and stale beer. Clean the carpets!  The toilet rocked back and forth and flushed loudly. The towels were dirty. The A/C was loud and inefficient. Very slow wifi. Lots of loud door slamming until the wee hours of the morning by other guests and staff did nothing. A real disappointment.
Context: Overuse of Febreze caused severe allergic reaction. I asked staff not to use it in our room. Our room was not sprayed, but the hallways were still overly toxic.
Sentence: Plus the room needs to be cleaned, not just masked, as the unsprayed room reeked of vomit, urine and stale beer.

Paragraph: This hotel was 5 stars from the moment we arrived. The scent in the lobby is very welcoming and cozy. Check in is very smooth and efficienct. They upgraded us without us even requesting from a one bedroom to a two bedroom suite. The rooms very spacious and had kitchens stocked with all essentials. Location of the hotel was perfect - right on the village stroll, surrounded by hundreds of restaurants and shops. The front desk doubled as concierge and were always very knowledgeable and helpful. Overall just very comfortable and convenient. The stay even includes complimentary bike rentals for an hour (including ebikes if you choose!) and paddleboard rentals for 3 hours. They also have a few restaurants in the building itself which we did not go to but are highly rated. Also has a rooftop hot tub open til 10pm. The only downside is that parking is an extra 32 dollars per night. Overall would highly recommend!
Context: Overall just very comfortable and convenient. The stay even includes complimentary bike rentals for an hour (including ebikes if you choose!) and paddleboard rentals for 3 hours.
Sentence: They also have a few restaurants in the building itself which we did not go to but are highly rated.

Paragraph: I almost don't want to let others know what an amazing hotel this is because then everyone will want to stay there. The Auberge absolutely lives up to the Relais & Chateaux distinction. There was not a single missed step or amenity lacking our entire stay. Upon check-in, our car was quickly valeted and bags taken care of. The impeccable front desk staff upgraded us to an incredibly lovely suite (see the photos) that made our trip to Quebec really seem like we were staying in a lovely home, not simply a hotel. Chocolate dipped strawberries and a handwritten note waited for us in the room. Each night the staff turned on music on the Bose sound system (a different selection each night), set some mood lighting (remote controlled flickering candles in the bedroom!), cleaned up the room a 2nd time, and refreshed our supply of bottled water. The main room had a deep couch, lovely writing desk, tall door/windows with lovely thick drapes, and a built in cabinet with a bar and closet (one minor inconvenience is that this is the only closet for the entire suite, none in the bedroom). The balcony off the main room was large enough for two chairs and a table, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a morning coffee or just hang out and read. The intimate king-bedded bedroom had a great amenity which I hadn't seen at a hotel yet: motion...I almost don't want to let others know what an amazing hotel this is because then everyone will want to stay there. The Auberge absolutely lives up to the Relais & Chateaux distinction. There was not a single missed step or amenity lacking our entire stay. Upon check-in, our car was quickly valeted and bags taken care of. The impeccable front desk staff upgraded us to an incredibly lovely suite (see the photos) that made our trip to Quebec really seem like we were staying in a lovely home, not simply a hotel. Chocolate dipped strawberries and a handwritten note waited for us in the room. Each night the staff turned on music on the Bose sound system (a different selection each night), set some mood lighting (remote controlled flickering candles in the bedroom!), cleaned up the room a 2nd time, and refreshed our supply of bottled water. The main room had a deep couch, lovely writing desk, tall door/windows with lovely thick drapes, and a built in cabinet with a bar and closet (one minor inconvenience is that this is the only closet for the entire suite, none in the bedroom). The balcony off the main room was large enough for two chairs and a table, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a morning coffee or just hang out and read. The intimate king-bedded bedroom had a great amenity which I hadn't seen at a hotel yet: motion activated light under the nightstands that offered just enough lighting to see where you were going in the middle of the night. Lovely touch! Again in the bedroom you had the huge door/windows with the thick drapes that didn't allow in a single stray morning ray, which meant I slept better here than I do in my own home. I can't say enough about the bathroom. From the japanese toilet (heated, air-dryed, bidet options, etc) to the heated floor to the deep soaking tub that was also big enough to be a shower, this bathroom was luxurious. It was so comfortable you almost didn't need the lovely robes and slippers they offered. And the surprise feature in this room was the auto-defogging area on the mirror above each sink. They literally thought of everything! If you like having a gym at your hotel this one will not disappoint with space for lots of activities. The hotel lobby was gorgeous with the ability to see the old foundations and excavations. You absolutely get the feel of history in this hotel so take 20 minutes to read about all the history. Breakfast in the lobby lounge was hearty and we really enjoyed it. Next time we come back (and we will!) I'm absolutely booking a suite because it really made the vacation feel like a retreat, especially after all that hard climbing around Quebec! Merci to the whole team at the Auberge!More
Context: Upon check-in, our car was quickly valeted and bags taken care of. The impeccable front desk staff upgraded us to an incredibly lovely suite (see the photos) that made our trip to Quebec really seem like we were staying in a lovely home, not simply a hotel. Chocolate dipped strawberries and a handwritten note waited for us in the room.
Sentence: Each night the staff turned on music on the Bose sound system (a different selection each night), set some mood lighting (remote controlled flickering candles in the bedroom!

Paragraph: Reserved a junior suite and for $139 USD I got a tiny room, 19" tv, and a bathroom without a door. This should rent for $45-50! Great location if you want to be in the middle of restaurants and shops- that's probably what you're paying for. Rooms are sub par. I wouldn't stay here again at this price... it is a cute little hotel but way overpriced.
Context: Reserved a junior suite and for $139 USD I got a tiny room, 19" tv, and a bathroom without a door. This should rent for $45-50!

Paragraph: I've been staying with the Hilton in Whistler for many years now.  Business trips or pleasure, the staff have always been very professional and helpful.  Any time of year is a great time to visit Whistler and the Hilton can cater to all your needs.  The Cinnamon bear is a fun casual dining experience with a great patio to enjoy some outside drinks and eats.  If the pool is more your speed, you can have drinks out there too.  Sports fans can always catch the game and in Winter, the Swedish Apres party keeps things going right off the slopes.
Context: I've been staying with the Hilton in Whistler for many years now. Business trips or pleasure, the staff have always been very professional and helpful.
Sentence: Any time of year is a great time to visit Whistler and the Hilton can cater to all your needs.

Paragraph: One of those shows that was massively hyped when it started and now seems to exist quietly in the background, loved by only a few.For me it lacks total historical accuracy, the people playing the key figures never look anything like them, and it's all a bit soap opera-esque.
Sentence: One of those shows that was massively hyped when it started and now seems to exist quietly in the background, loved by only a few.

Paragraph: The Midnight Sky is dull, empty and unevoking.If the highs are having songs play, then make a film about music, my god. The 1959 film "On the Beach," isn't good either, but at least that has a decent cast. Put some likable characters in it, for Pete's sake. Poor dialogue and casting.
Context: The Midnight Sky is dull, empty and unevoking.If the highs are having songs play, then make a film about music, my god. The 1959 film "On the Beach," isn't good either, but at least that has a decent cast.
Sentence: Put some likable characters in it, for Pete's sake.

Paragraph: I didn't expect to enjoy Ma Rainey's Black Bottom as much as I did. In fact, it's currently my favourite film of 2020, and I've seen a lot of flicks this year.Chadwick Boseman gives the best performance of his career, and I'm not just saying that because he tragically passed away earlier this year. He was phenomenal, and easily a top five performance of the entire year. This man would have probably had an Oscar on his mantle within the next five years, and it's such a shame that he'll never get that now.Viola Davis was also fantastic. Everyone else in the cast turned in near-perfect performances, but it was really Boseman and Davis' film.It's fair to say that Ma Rainey's Black Bottom is much more of a character study and acting showcase than heavy on plot, but that didn't bother me in the slightest.Almost all of the film takes place on the stage or in the basement where the band practices, and I'm a big fan of films with single-locations. 12 Angry Men is probably the best example of this, but I also loved The Boys in the Band that came out earlier this year.Aside from the incredible acting, the screenplay is what really made me fall in love with this film. The dialogue is crisp, the character backstories are interesting, and I was completely invested in everything that was happening.There were five minutes that dragged a little in the middle of the film, but that's my only criticism with it. I was also a little surprised by the turn that happened at the very end of the film, but it wasn't really a negative. I'm not sure how I feel about it, so I'll probably rewatch the film soon to get a more concrete opinion on the ending. However, for now, I'll say that it worked because of all the set-up and backstory that Levee was given.I had never heard of the play that this was based on before now, but watching the film made me curious to do some research.Aside from a tiny section in the middle of the film, Ma Rainey's Black Bottom was mesmerising. It features powerhouse performances and one of the best screenplays of the year, which means that I absolutely have to recommend it.SCORE: 97%
Context: The dialogue is crisp, the character backstories are interesting, and I was completely invested in everything that was happening.There were five minutes that dragged a little in the middle of the film, but that's my only criticism with it. I was also a little surprised by the turn that happened at the very end of the film, but it wasn't really a negative. I'm not sure how I feel about it, so I'll probably rewatch the film soon to get a more concrete opinion on the ending.
Sentence: However, for now, I'll say that it worked because of all the set-up and backstory that Levee was given.I had never heard of the play that this was based on before now, but watching the film made me curious to do some research.Aside from a tiny section in the middle of the film, Ma Rainey's Black Bottom was mesmerising.

Paragraph: Soul is phenomenal, Pixar at its best with a simple yet powerful message whilst also being an extremely inventive, really funny and emotional adventure. Jaime Foxx and Tina Fey are both incredible. Rachel House and Richard Ayoade are both great, as is Graham Norton surprisingly. The animation is phenomenal and breathtaking and Pete Doctor's direction is superb. The music by Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross is excellent.
Context: Soul is phenomenal, Pixar at its best with a simple yet powerful message whilst also being an extremely inventive, really funny and emotional adventure. Jaime Foxx and Tina Fey are both incredible. Rachel House and Richard Ayoade are both great, as is Graham Norton surprisingly.
Sentence: The animation is phenomenal and breathtaking and Pete Doctor's direction is superb.

Paragraph: I am not a royalist by any means. In fact, I often wonder why kings and queens exist in the 21st century. I marvel that they don't come to their senses themselves and join the human race as it is. So, I did balk at watching this Netflix offering at first.I am glad I dipped my toe in by watching the first episode. I was immediately seduced by the richness of its writing, its editing, its presentation and its talent. I was also rewarded with a balanced view of the monarchy as institution vs. personality. Flawed and tortured human beings poured into rigid traditional roles. Claire Foy is simply remarkable. Matt Smith is a perfect foil. Victoria Hamilton and Eileen Atkins provide weighty and humorous ballast. The cast is too deep to acknowledge individually here, but any fan of British productions will be wowed. Alex Jennings deserves mention as David, Duke of Windsor. Vanessa Kirby shines as Princess Margaret.Well worth a Netflix binge. We highly recommend it.
Context: I was also rewarded with a balanced view of the monarchy as institution vs. personality. Flawed and tortured human beings poured into rigid traditional roles. Claire Foy is simply remarkable.
Sentence: Matt Smith is a perfect foil.

Paragraph: While the show seemed to lose its way a bit in the later episodes, it was ultimately an engaging murder mystery. The first 6 or so episodes definitely keep you intrigued, and it's different from the format of your typical murder mystery (there are more layers beyond the basic "whodunnit" that keep you going). My biggest criticism would just be that it tries to do too much--there are too many characters we're supposed to care about for an 8 episode series. But other than that, it's a fun show and a pretty small investment (you can binge it in less than a week).
Sentence: While the show seemed to lose its way a bit in the later episodes, it was ultimately an engaging murder mystery.

Paragraph: It is a testament to how good this series is that a dramatization of such a well known person and such well known events could be so mesmerizing. The detail is just mind boggling. There is such painstaking detail to recreate each scene from Commonwealth tours to minor ones. The sets are sumptuous and the costumes are perfect. No wonder it cost so much to make. The writing is superb with such good dialog in the intimate scenes that one only imagined before. Just finished season 1, all 10 episodes and each one is better than the last. Quite shocking to see on screen (even though it is known) is the vitriolic hatred Edward VIII had for the rest of the Windsors due to the treatment of Wallis.Some of the outstanding aspects of this first season are the handling of marriage with divorced persons - both with Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson and with Princess Margaret's love for the divorced Peter Townsend. A well handled angle is the difficult position the Queen finds herself in. Even marital conflict is shown with Prince Philip portrayed rather negatively. Do feel more sympathy for the Queen after watching this series.The flaw in this series is the jarring miscasting of some of the characters. Jared Harris looks too different from George VI and the actress who plays the Queen Mother is also terribly miscast - she should have been a plumper more round looking actress. They don't capture their essences. Vanessa Kirby is a bit indelicate for Margaret - maybe a bit large. Claire Foy does a good imitation of the Queen's accent but she has a rather hesitant look - more suitable for the household staff than the Queen. She doesn't look regal. But maybe she will change later. Physically her face is rather too different. Surprisingly Matt Smith the weird actor from Dr Who although uglier than Prince Phillip does capture his essence. John Lithgow even though too tall acts so well as Churchill it's quite award worthy. But the errors in casting don't prevent this series being outstanding television.
Context: Do feel more sympathy for the Queen after watching this series.The flaw in this series is the jarring miscasting of some of the characters. Jared Harris looks too different from George VI and the actress who plays the Queen Mother is also terribly miscast - she should have been a plumper more round looking actress. They don't capture their essences.
Sentence: Vanessa Kirby is a bit indelicate for Margaret - maybe a bit large.

Paragraph: Probably one of the most spot-on titles of all time...and one of Pixar's best ever.This inspiring movie came at the most appropriate time in 2020. It wants to remind us to LIVE, BREATHE and LOVE LIFE. What better message to give on Christmas day?Joe's focused on becoming a Jazz player for a living, but has been held back all his life from outside forces/events. Or has he? When an accident happens on the day of what appears to be the gig of his life to make his dreams come true, he's forced to mentor a lost soul as he tries to fulfill his purpose. Or so he tells himself.I was intentionally vague in that synopsis as much as I could as I went into this almost completely blind having only seen a few seconds of clips online. There's so much to unravel here, it's best you discover this gem all by yourself.The music and score are perfect, the humor hilarious - I was thoroughly laughing out loud a ton and the heart is 100% shown. Not to mention the animation is spectacular - it's so good, you forget all about it and focus on the laughs, story and morals. And I bet the excellent animators want that to be true for everyone.I can't recommend this movie enough. It's so unlike other Pixar movies, it feels like it's in a new class of its own. I'm not ready to call it my favorite Pixar film...yet. And that's probably, again, because it feels so different. Elevated. A new breed. Adult.Oh, if anything: watch this to remember why we live and breathe. Why we have (a) Soul.***Final thoughts: On a personal note, I've always wanted to visit a genuine, established and real jazz club someday. Was close once in Seattle a few years back, but other plans got in the way. Headed back to Seattle soon and if this plague finally subsides, I hope to live that dream soon after.
Context: Probably one of the most spot-on titles of all time...and one of Pixar's best ever.This inspiring movie came at the most appropriate time in 2020. It wants to remind us to LIVE, BREATHE and LOVE LIFE.
Sentence: What better message to give on Christmas day?Joe's focused on becoming a Jazz player for a living, but has been held back all his life from outside forces/events.

Paragraph: Unlike many people, I don't particularly like seeing movies more than once. Of course there are some exceptions, but I am not a person who usually sees a movie again and again--I find this very boring. However, there are several exceptions--and this movie probably heads the list. Unlike other films this one actually becomes better with repeated viewings--and it's great to see and hear the wonderful and silly lines again--especially when they are are friends and family there to see it and laugh along with you. Perfect writing (albeit, very, very cynical), wonderful acting, great attention to details (the 1940s look to the film is great--down to the boxes of soap and radio programs) and so many funny and sentimental moments make this a perennial favorite. If you haven't seen this then get out from under your rock and see it! If you don't like it, then think about getting psychiatric help! No sane person could hate this wonderful film.
Context: Perfect writing (albeit, very, very cynical), wonderful acting, great attention to details (the 1940s look to the film is great--down to the boxes of soap and radio programs) and so many funny and sentimental moments make this a perennial favorite. If you haven't seen this then get out from under your rock and see it! If you don't like it, then think about getting psychiatric help!
Sentence: No sane person could hate this wonderful film.

Paragraph: Wonder Woman 1984(WW1984) is the new DC fantasy sequel to the 2017 film Wonder Woman. This time Diana Prince (Gal Gadot) is still mourning the loss of her lover Steve Trevor(Chris Pine who died in the first movie). But when a mysterious artifact is found at the workplace where Diana works all hell breaks lose as an evil oil tycoon named Maxwell Lord(Pedro Pascal) and a nerdy woman named Barbara (Kirsten Wigg) want the power of the artifact as it wishes for the other person's desires,especially when Diana wishes Steve to come back(he becomes reincarnated as someone else..just don't ask).Will Wonder Woman save the man she loves once more and defeat the new villains or will she sacrifice herself?.Overall it was a good sequel but it's not as great as the original one which was alot more better since it had more action sequences and the plot was more easier to follow here in this sequel it's like I was watching an episode of Quantum Leap(with Steve becoming someone else). Also parts of it was like The Amazing Spiderman 2 with Barbara being so nerdy and goofy just like Max from TASM2. The CGI of Cheetah was meh as we only seen her at night and that's it. Also back to Steve Trevor coming back from the dead I was like ok so Diana saw this guy as Steve and everyone else sees Steve as the guy his possessing. It just drove me crazy as it took me a while to get the jest of it. As well as that we get to see a young Diana again and I thought that the film was a time travelling film.If you love Wonder Woman then watch the 2017 one instead as that was far more superior. Also stay tuned for the credits as a familiar face shows up.C-
Context: This time Diana Prince (Gal Gadot) is still mourning the loss of her lover Steve Trevor(Chris Pine who died in the first movie). But when a mysterious artifact is found at the workplace where Diana works all hell breaks lose as an evil oil tycoon named Maxwell Lord(Pedro Pascal) and a nerdy woman named Barbara (Kirsten Wigg) want the power of the artifact as it wishes for the other person's desires,especially when Diana wishes Steve to come back(he becomes reincarnated as someone else..just don't ask).Will Wonder Woman save the man she loves once more and defeat the new villains or will she sacrifice herself?.Overall it was a good sequel but it's not as great as the original one which was alot more better since it had more action sequences and the plot was more easier to follow here in this sequel it's like I was watching an episode of Quantum Leap(with Steve becoming someone else). Also parts of it was like The Amazing Spiderman 2 with Barbara being so nerdy and goofy just like Max from TASM2.
Sentence: The CGI of Cheetah was meh as we only seen her at night and that's it.

Paragraph: Incredibly enjoyable, entertaining and phenomenal! Dafne Keen and James McAvoy are superb! The writing and acting is on point with so much brilliance and plenty of high hopes of more greatness to come. His Dark Materials is impeccable on HBO, I don't know much about the story quite yet but the pilot is a leap in the right direction.
Context: Incredibly enjoyable, entertaining and phenomenal!
Sentence: Dafne Keen and James McAvoy are superb!

Paragraph: The Midnight Sky: Augustine (George Clooney) is an astronomer who searches for habitable planets. He's in the Arctic at an observatory in 2049 when an Event occurs which kills much of the Earth's population. When the base is evacuated Augustine stays, he hasn't long to live due to a terminal illness. Heck! He could outlive the rest of humanity as they seek shelter under ground. But a young girl Iris (Caoilinn Springall) is left behind, Augustine now has to look after her. Returning from Jupiter is the spaceship Aether, It has confirmed that one of Jupiter's moons is suitable colonisation. But it cannot contact Earth, is unaware of the catastrophe which has struck. Augustine hears a broadcast from astronaut Sully (Felicity Jones) and is determined to communicate with the Aether and so heads off with Iris to another base which has a more powerful antennae.So two odyssey's begin. Augustine and Iris traverse the Arctic ice and tundra; discover a crashed plane , mysteriously full of objets d'art, encounter wolves, brave ice-breaks and the freezing temperatures and blizzards. The astronauts have to deal with an environment even more deadly with equipment failure and space debris strikes. Some great shots of the Aether which looks as if it came from a fusion of Discovery One (2001) and Valley Forge (Silent Running). Tension in both space and the Arctic build as as they approach their destinations.Some great acting from Jones, Clooney and Springall (who remains mute for most of her screen time). Augustine also reflectys on his past life and in flashbacks we see how he lost the love of his life, Jean (Sophie rundle) another scientist, due to his obsessive devotion to his work. The chemistry between Clooney and Springall sparkles when his reserve breaks down and they flick peas at each other. Not just Science Fiction or another apocalypse movie. This is a story of lost love, a lost world, new bonds and some plot twists which you'll have to unwind for yourselves. Directed by George Clooney and written by Mark L. Smith (Overlord, The Revenant) . On Netflix. 8/10.
Context: Heck! He could outlive the rest of humanity as they seek shelter under ground. But a young girl Iris (Caoilinn Springall) is left behind, Augustine now has to look after her.
Sentence: Returning from Jupiter is the spaceship Aether, It has confirmed that one of Jupiter's moons is suitable colonisation.

Paragraph: Following a muddlesome terrorist attack on an opera, this unnamed chap (who I shall call Z) is introduced to the phenomenon of inversion. Inversion is the reversal of entropy, and can be applied to an object, a location, one or more individuals etc. This means that time can run forwards and backwards at more or less the same time in more or less the same place. It is dangerous: if overused it can overbalance entropy, which will end everything. And a nasty Russian piece of work is trying to collect bits of a mechanism so that he can activate an algorithm...Christopher Nolan's latest follows Inception and interstellar and, if you thought they were difficult to understand and follow, you ain't seen nothin' yet.Inversion is a great maguffin. The problem here is that in order to follow the story, you need to have an understanding of how inversion works, and that's exactly what you don't get here. In fact a lady scientist early on says "Don't try to understand it, just accept it," and this is effectively writer/director talking to the viewer. I think this is code for him saying "I haven't really thought this through completely, so don't expect it to make sense." Given that it has taken him years to write this...There are various problems. Given that you have time running backwards and forwards at the same time, it's fair to generate an element of "What's going on?" to be answered when a reverse-time sequence unfolds in positive time back to its start at the end. But what I just said gives some indication of how preplexing the film is when much of it is told that way. A number of IMDB reviews say it was gibberish on first viewing, made sense on second viewing. My opinion is that you shouldn't have to see a film twice for it to make sense, especially if it takes a frustrating two and a half hours to watch it once.The next problem is that dialogue is mumbled and buried under general noise, making it nearly impossible to hear very necessary exposition.I'm not going to go on about this film which would have been a great deal better if it had been a great deal simpler, and which would have benefitted from Nolan having a co-writer on board to act as the viewer's friend. This film is NOT the greatest thing since sliced bread. I give it 5 out of 10, which is what happens when a 10/10 positive entropy maguffin meets an inversed 0/10 script.
Context: A number of IMDB reviews say it was gibberish on first viewing, made sense on second viewing. My opinion is that you shouldn't have to see a film twice for it to make sense, especially if it takes a frustrating two and a half hours to watch it once.The next problem is that dialogue is mumbled and buried under general noise, making it nearly impossible to hear very necessary exposition.I'm not going to go on about this film which would have been a great deal better if it had been a great deal simpler, and which would have benefitted from Nolan having a co-writer on board to act as the viewer's friend. This film is NOT the greatest thing since sliced bread.
Sentence: I give it 5 out of 10, which is what happens when a 10/10 positive entropy maguffin meets an inversed 0/10 script.

Paragraph: Frank Capra's sometimes dark post-war film, "It's a Wonderful Life" was released in 1946. It was intended to be released in 1947, but when a Technicolor print of "Sinbad" couldn't be delivered on time, this film was put into release. For that reason, "It's a Wonderful Life" - possibly the most wonderful film ever made - was overshadowed by "The Best Years of Our Lives." But you can't keep a great film down, and as the years have passed, "It's a Wonderful Life" has found its place as an iconic film that means Christmas. It's survived the public domain (due to a clerical error, when the copyright was not renewed in 1974), where it was cut to ribbons and shown so often on television (and why not, networks could show it for nothing) that people were sick of it. Now that it has to be licensed again in order to be shown, the film is shown in its totality and not as often.This remarkable story of a man who sacrifices his dreams for the betterment of his community and the business his father built resonates today more than ever, when it often seems like no one cares about anything except what's in it for them. James Stewart is perfect as a caring man who swallows disappointment after disappointment and finally is ready to give up, until he is given the gift of seeing what would have happened had he never been born. No man, he learns, is poor who has friends.I can't think of a better message or anything more inspirational than can be found in this film. George Bailey is all of us, and his story is a reminder that we're all important and, no matter how tough it gets, we need to keep going. One of my favorite movies.
Context: It's survived the public domain (due to a clerical error, when the copyright was not renewed in 1974), where it was cut to ribbons and shown so often on television (and why not, networks could show it for nothing) that people were sick of it. Now that it has to be licensed again in order to be shown, the film is shown in its totality and not as often.This remarkable story of a man who sacrifices his dreams for the betterment of his community and the business his father built resonates today more than ever, when it often seems like no one cares about anything except what's in it for them. James Stewart is perfect as a caring man who swallows disappointment after disappointment and finally is ready to give up, until he is given the gift of seeing what would have happened had he never been born.
Sentence: No man, he learns, is poor who has friends.I can't think of a better message or anything more inspirational than can be found in this film.

Paragraph: There's so much to digest with this movie. Time moving forwards and backwards at the same time is mind blowing. The plot is chaotic, admittedly I only had a vague notion of what was going on throughout the film. The time changes are beautifully synchronized and flow seamlessly. The cinematography is beautiful. Acting was great from the whole cast.
Context: There's so much to digest with this movie.
Sentence: Time moving forwards and backwards at the same time is mind blowing.

Paragraph: Elf seems to have become a Christmas Classic over the years. The kind of film kids want to see each December along with Home Alone.The premise is rather silly. Will Ferrell is an infant adopted in the North Pole and wrongly thinks he is an elf despite being much taller than the other elves.The naive Ferrell decides to go to New York in search of his real father once he finds out the truth. Dad happens to be the more cynical James Caan who is rather taken aback by a long lost son who thinks he is an elf and maybe borderline retarded.Ferrell gets a job helping out at Santa's grotto in a department store while trying to connect with his father. He also helps the real Santa by getting the public some real Christmas spirit to make his sleigh soar.The film is both silly and charming. Kids will love it but adults may find it a little bit over the top.Ferrell has enough charm to pull off the role. James Caan on the other hand has found a new generation of fans who know him as Walter and not Sonny Corleone.
Sentence: Elf seems to have become a Christmas Classic over the years.

Paragraph: The Mandalorian is one series that entertains with action and adventure and you can just feel the "Star Wars" atmosphere as the scenes and backdrops show the universe and many characters are noticeable set after the fall of the empire and before the rise of a new order in the republic the series follows the travels and life of one lone bounty hunter. The action and adventure keeps you glued and the discovery of one little cute pointy long eared green baby is a nice wild card and supporting theme for the series. Really good work from the "Star Wars" universe a must watch for the saga's fan base.
Context: The Mandalorian is one series that entertains with action and adventure and you can just feel the "Star Wars" atmosphere as the scenes and backdrops show the universe and many characters are noticeable set after the fall of the empire and before the rise of a new order in the republic the series follows the travels and life of one lone bounty hunter.
Sentence: The action and adventure keeps you glued and the discovery of one little cute pointy long eared green baby is a nice wild card and supporting theme for the series.

Paragraph: Love Actually is a romantic comedy that features an ensemble cast that includes Hugh Grant,Liam Neeson,Colin Firth,Laura Linney,Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman,Keira Knightley,Martine McCutcheon,Bill Nighy and Rowan Atkinson.The screenplay delves into different aspects of love as shown through ten separate stories involving a wide variety of individuals, many of whom are shown to be interlinked as their tales progress. It was written and directed by Richard Curtis. The story involves more than a dozen main characters, each weaving his or her way into another's heart over the course of one particularly eventful Christmas. The seemingly perfect wedding of Juliet and Peter brings many of the principals together, including heartsick best man Mark, who harbors a very unrequited crush on Juliet. There's also recent widower Daniel, trying to help his lonely stepson Sam express his true feelings to a classmate. Across town, devoted working mother Karen tries to rekindle the passion of her husband, Harry, who secretly pines for a young colleague of his. In the same office, the lonely Sarah not-so- secretly pines for a man just a few desks away, who returns her affections but may not be able to dissuade her neuroses. Providing the unofficial soundtrack for all of the couples is an aging rocker who just wants to cash in and get laid -- but even he might find a meaningful relationship in the most unlikely of places.Despite of the many characters involved,this is a actually a terrific film.There is plenty of entertainment in this well acted ensemble comedy considering that it has created a joyful date movie that'll leave you with a smile on your face and an almost irresistible urge to hug somebody.A highly recommended romantic comedy.
Context: The seemingly perfect wedding of Juliet and Peter brings many of the principals together, including heartsick best man Mark, who harbors a very unrequited crush on Juliet. There's also recent widower Daniel, trying to help his lonely stepson Sam express his true feelings to a classmate. Across town, devoted working mother Karen tries to rekindle the passion of her husband, Harry, who secretly pines for a young colleague of his.
Sentence: In the same office, the lonely Sarah not-so- secretly pines for a man just a few desks away, who returns her affections but may not be able to dissuade her neuroses.

Paragraph: A CIA agent is given an unusual assignment: track down the source of inverted bullets, bullets that move backwards through time. This will hopefully lead him to the source of entropy-reversal technology from the future.Christopher Nolan is one of my favourite directors, with Memento ranking, for me, as the second greatest movie of all time. Being written and directed by him you know it is going to be clever and complex.Here, however, he lays on the complexity but fails to make it entirely understandable. Twists and cleverness just for twists and cleverness sake. Throw in the fact that the dialogue often gets drowned out by the loud, droning, this-is-a-key-moment-so-needs-loud-music score (a trick Nolan picked up in Dunkirk, where we had that irritating droning sound throughout the movie) and the plot is difficult to follow. At a point I gave up trying to understand the concepts behind the plot, or follow the plot itself, and just went along for the ride.In addition to being not entirely comprehensible, the film is more an action movie than an intelligent thriller. It has many traits of a Bond film: jet-setting locations, find A to get to B to get to C with the slimmest links between the different parts in the chain. This all an excuse for some outlandish scheme or action sequence. Plus the villain has the opportunity to quickly kill the hero several times but chooses not too - very Bond-like. Add in the perfectly-choreographed action sequences, many big, bright explosions and it's more style than substance.This said, it is reasonably enjoyable. The action sequences are well done, it moves at a great pace and doesn't feel like a 2.5-hour movie.Performances are pretty solid, especially from John David Washington (in the lead role) and Elizabeth Debicki. Kenneth Branagh does his best fake Russian accent and seems every inch the Bond villain. I have never liked Robert Pattinson, thanks to that Twilight crap, but was hoping here he could prove he had some decent dramatic acting skills. Sadly, no, he doesn't.More style than substance, and below Christopher Nolan's usual standard, but reasonably entertaining.
Context: Plus the villain has the opportunity to quickly kill the hero several times but chooses not too - very Bond-like. Add in the perfectly-choreographed action sequences, many big, bright explosions and it's more style than substance.This said, it is reasonably enjoyable. The action sequences are well done, it moves at a great pace and doesn't feel like a 2.5-hour movie.Performances are pretty solid, especially from John David Washington (in the lead role) and Elizabeth Debicki.
Sentence: Kenneth Branagh does his best fake Russian accent and seems every inch the Bond villain.

Paragraph: Production and acting are solid, that's on the plus side, on the con side: a very slow and boring story told. This of course makes the movie almost unwatchable - but if you want to dip fast into the arms of Morpheus (ancient god of sleep) The Midnight Sky might do, but in the case that you want entertainment and/or something to feed your mind, it won't work. Also the twist with the girl is obvious within a couple of minutes, you just have to use your brains. And, of course, the last survivors are a black man and a white woman (mankind will distinct anyway, how a couple should restart mankind is a mystery only the writers can answer) - in this sense I would even dare to call the movie very racist: Asian or South American people for example (like in many movies) do not play any role in this movie: a white woman and a man of African origin man must survive (like in other movies too) - why not an Asian woman and a South-American man for a change? Anyway, The Midnight Sky is a Netflix production like many: hire some known actors, put some money into the production and technical staff and voila you got a new movie. The script!? Not important at all. My rating is 4, but only because of the decent production value I added one point, the movie I would rate a 3 and no more.
Context: This of course makes the movie almost unwatchable - but if you want to dip fast into the arms of Morpheus (ancient god of sleep) The Midnight Sky might do, but in the case that you want entertainment and/or something to feed your mind, it won't work. Also the twist with the girl is obvious within a couple of minutes, you just have to use your brains. And, of course, the last survivors are a black man and a white woman (mankind will distinct anyway, how a couple should restart mankind is a mystery only the writers can answer) - in this sense I would even dare to call the movie very racist: Asian or South American people for example (like in many movies) do not play any role in this movie: a white woman and a man of African origin man must survive (like in other movies too) - why not an Asian woman and a South-American man for a change?
Sentence: Anyway, The Midnight Sky is a Netflix production like many: hire some known actors, put some money into the production and technical staff and voila you got a new movie.

Paragraph: My wife and I chose this for our Christmas night viewing even though we have seen it before. It is currently available on Amazon streaming movies.WW2 ended in 1945 and this movie was made in 1946. The premise is straightforward, George Bailey ( James Stewart, 38 at the time) had been a fine boy growing up and now as an adult often gave up his own goals for the benefit of others, like his younger brother. Perhaps too generous, when his Building and Loan business was in trouble he was contemplating suicide as a way out, thinking the world would be better off if George Bailey had never existed.An angel is sent down to intervene, in the last third of the movie George gets to see exactly how his town would have been and in the process gets his head straight.Donna Reed (23 at the time) played his wife Mary who would have been the stereotypical "old maid librarian" if George had never existed.Filmed in glorious B&W, the film holds up very well all these years later when one pits it against other very old movies.
Context: My wife and I chose this for our Christmas night viewing even though we have seen it before. It is currently available on Amazon streaming movies.WW2 ended in 1945 and this movie was made in 1946. The premise is straightforward, George Bailey ( James Stewart, 38 at the time) had been a fine boy growing up and now as an adult often gave up his own goals for the benefit of others, like his younger brother.
Sentence: Perhaps too generous, when his Building and Loan business was in trouble he was contemplating suicide as a way out, thinking the world would be better off if George Bailey had never existed.An angel is sent down to intervene, in the last third of the movie George gets to see exactly how his town would have been and in the process gets his head straight.Donna Reed (23 at the time) played his wife Mary who would have been the stereotypical "old maid librarian" if George had never existed.Filmed in glorious B&W, the film holds up very well all these years later when one pits it against other very old movies.

Paragraph: It's 2049 in the Arctic Circle. A science station is being evacuated as an apocalyptic event spreads throughout the world. Augustine Lofthouse (George Clooney) is the only one staying behind since he has a terminal illness anyways. He is shocked to find a little girl left behind. Meanwhile, there is a spacecraft returning to Earth from an Earth-like moon orbiting Jupiter. The crew members are Sully (Felicity Jones), Adewole (David Oyelowo), Mitchell (Kyle Chandler), Sanchez (Demián Bichir), and Maya (Tiffany Boone). They are confused with their inability to contact Earth.This looks physically good but ultimately lifeless. In general, there are three stories being told. The flashback to young Lofthouse is rather unnecessary. It adds very little to his story. I assumed that Clooney may be trying to connect it with the little girl but that doesn't happen. The girl and Clooney hold the best part of the movie. The general premise doesn't make sense but if one ignores that, it actually works as a small adventure. There is no way that everybody would evacuate the base for certain doom. I just watched Greenland where people are killing each other for any small chance of a fractionally longer life. Having said that, one can ignore the flawed premise for the sake of the movie. That finally gets to the spacecraft section. It is the least compelling group. Clooney is doing a mix between Gravity and Steven Soderbergh's Solaris. He has great actors and wastes them with paper thin characters. It's a thriller trying to be thrilling and failing. It doesn't help that the ending is a story fading out to whatever. Only Clooney and the little girl serve as good movie material. Even there, the premise screws up the narrative.
Context: The crew members are Sully (Felicity Jones), Adewole (David Oyelowo), Mitchell (Kyle Chandler), Sanchez (Demián Bichir), and Maya (Tiffany Boone). They are confused with their inability to contact Earth.This looks physically good but ultimately lifeless. In general, there are three stories being told.
Sentence: The flashback to young Lofthouse is rather unnecessary.

Paragraph: Cargo containers, pick up sticks for space ships, machine gun style lasers, where does the story begin...? There is so much that could be interesting in this series, but apparently the producers decided to just make it a mish mash of disconnected action, unintelligible dialog and weird space battles that defy physics...If there is a plot you can follow, you're much better at watching it than I am. To me, there is no coherent story line, and the battle sequences in space have gunners firing in all directions, rather than at targets of opportunity...Even Stargate Universe, the worst in that franchise, had a credible plot...this one does not !!!
Sentence: Cargo containers, pick up sticks for space ships, machine gun style lasers, where does the story begin...?

Paragraph: I can not believe that I did not see this movie before now. Maybe when I was 8, when White Christmas was on every year, I wasn't as into musicals as I am now, save movies like Annie, Wizard of Oz and Oliver! I am truly sorry, for this was an excellent film, that is perfect for the Christmas holiday season. White Christmas looks lovely, shot in beautiful Vista Vision with nice cinematography and wonderful costumes. The red dresses in the reprise of White Christmas especially were to die for. The songs and score by Irving Berlin is outstanding; the title song White Christmas is not only one of my all time favourite Christmas songs but also one of my favourite songs ever in a musical. But the other songs go without fault too, particularly The Best Things Happen When You're Dancing and Sisters.The script and story, serving as a partial remake of Holiday Inn, are top notch, if a little fluffy and implausible in places. Even better were the performances, with Bing Crosby his usual charming self as Bob, and while weak at the start Danny Kaye is superb as Phil. His dance routine with Vera Ellen, who looked gorgeous here and sang and danced a dream, was a knockout. Rosemary Clooney is positively riveting as Betty as well, in a suitably calm and subdued performance. I have to say I loved the choreography, it was clever, fast-paced and energetic. Overall, it may be fluff and a tad schmaltzy, but it is an excellent and timeless holiday movie. 10/10 Bethany Cox
Context: I can not believe that I did not see this movie before now. Maybe when I was 8, when White Christmas was on every year, I wasn't as into musicals as I am now, save movies like Annie, Wizard of Oz and Oliver!
Sentence: I am truly sorry, for this was an excellent film, that is perfect for the Christmas holiday season.
